column4: Hello. Is there anyone here who are using an ITX board with Ubuntu? If so, how well do Compiz Fusion work with it?
an itx board has no relevance on compiz-fusion
your video card has the effect you're worried about
Well, the ITX boards has integrated videocards and processors that cannot be changed, so I'm actually asking about the entire system.
itx boards could have any variation of video card, disk controllers, chipsets, all that can effect cmopiz
there are 100's of combinations some will work better than others
Of course, but there are only 2 (I think) graphic circuits available, so they all should be rather similar.
no, there are multiple
multiple brands, and multiple versions of the chips
It sounds like you have an ITX board?
I have a few yes
How awesome. Have you tried Compiz on them?
it runs by default on anything more than ubutnu 7.10 so yes
Yes, but does it run flawlessly even with the cube and such?
depends on which machine I'm on with which cards and configs I have, some work better than others
Do you have a Epia-NX12000EG with 1 GB RAM?
no
Alright, although I realize some of the cards will work better with Compiz than others, but with your cards, how well do it work?
fine
Thanks alot :)
can we dro the non-support chat please.
